intro: Chiococca brachiata var. subrhombea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chiococca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive violet or purple color. This variant is notable for its adaptation to high-altitude environments and its role in local ecosystems.
